title: The safety requirements of CStr::from_ptr have been made more strict than they used to be

### Location

`CStr::from_ptr`

### Summary

#95948 introduced incompatible changes to the `CStr` docs. Namely, the docs now require immutability for the whole lifetime of `'a`, instead of just while it's borrowed. See also [this discussion on urlo](https://users.rust-lang.org/t/is-this-technically-sound/79783). This is relevant to our crate, `ltptr`, which provides bound lifetimes for raw pointers and uses those in conversions: https://docs.rs/ltptr/0.1.4/ltptr/trait.FromLtPtr.html
